result.execSummary:
The defendant David George Richards was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees during the period of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Maintain fulltime/part time employment, and/or schooling.
No contact with the victim or victim's family.  No contact within a three block radius of 400 E. Ward Street.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David George Richards

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Amelia S.  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26190117 in court 1x on 9/16/2015.
Request for payment of $17 witness fees for witness Delisa S.  processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26190116 in court 1x on 9/16/2015.
Witness fee request prepared for Amelia S. was approved for 1 appearance on 9/16/15 by the DAs Victim/Witness Services.
Witness fee request prepared for Delisa S. was approved for 1 appearance on 9/16/15 by the DAs Victim/Witness Services.
Witness fee request prepared for Amelia S. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.
Witness fee request prepared for Delisa S. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant. Additional statements made by victim and victim's mother.

Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS, STRAIGHT TIME, in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year with the following conditions:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees during the period of probation.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  Maintain absolute sobriety.
*  No contact with the victim or victim's family. No contact within a three block radius of 400 East Ward Street.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant David George Richards in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. On motion of the State Court DISMISSED the Repeater portion of the charge.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant David George Richards in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial. Parties ready to proceed. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 09/16/2015 at 8:30am.  Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.
from the State received and filed.
from the State received and filed.
from the State received and filed.
filed by the state.

Defendant David George Richards in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Case adjourned to Branch 46.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David George Richards in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record.  State turned over an offer and discovery. Defense requests additional time to review discovery with defendant.  Case adjourned to Branch 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with D.S.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.

Defendant David George Richards in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant David George Richards in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Reserve Branch 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
